fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Education and training, Enlargement, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Research and innovation, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
Main activities:  
 
European policy affecting the competitiveness of manufacturing  
  
Industrial policy dialogue, consultations and specialist high level groups in DG Enterprise:  
•    Key Enabling Technologies or ‘KETs’ High Level Group (advanced manufacturing) 
•    Task Force for Advanced Manufacturing  
 
H2020 and European actions for innovation, including Public Private Partnerships, European Innovation Partnerships (raw materials, water etc) and Joint Technology  Initiatives  
 
Technical and regulatory affairs, on standards, certification and harmonization:  
•    Machinery Directive 
•    Energy using Products EuP 
•    Labelling (water and energy using products) 
•    REACH 
•    Electric motors in vacuum cleaners 
•    European machinery certification systems e.g. PM10 
 
Civil Society dialogue on Trade topics, on regulatory convergence to reduce non-tariff barriers: 
•    Bilateral trade agreements
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: High Level expert Group on energy-intensive industries#E03326#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3326#Observer#C#Sherpa Group#Working Group for Non Road Mobile Machinery (Emission from non road mobile machinery engines)#E01346#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1346#Member#C#Expert Group on liability and new technologies #E03592#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3592#Member#C#Product Liability Directive formation#Noise Expert Group#E02809#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=2809#Member#C
membership: EUnited is a founder member of SPIRE PPP on Resource & Energy Efficiency, which is broad platform representing the Process Industry established on 18th July 2012 and preparing a process industry innovation roadmap to 2030.
relevant_communication:
Main activities:  
 
Raising awareness among European policy makers about manufacturing and its contribution to the European economy including employment and essential products and services.  
  
Contributing expertise on industrial policy, by participation in consultations and specialist high level groups in DG Enterprise.  
 
Participation in European innovation projects 
•    DG Employment project "Sustainability & skills in the Machine tools & Robotics sector”  
 
Public private partnerships:   
•    Sustainable Process Industries ‘SPIRE’  
•    Factories of the Future ‘EFFRA’  
•    Robotics PPP 'Sparc'  
 
Technical and regulatory affairs, on standards, certification and harmonization:  
•    Machinery Directive 
•    Energy using Products EuP 
•    Labelling (water and energy using products) 
•    REACH 
•    Electric motors 
•    European machinery certification systems e.g. PM10 
 
Civil Society dialogue on Trade topics, on regulatory convergence to reduce non-tariff barriers: 
•    Bilateral trade agreements
goals__remit:
EUnited - European Engineering Industries Association is a Brussels-based service provider for European Engineering industries, specifically for equipment suppliers.  
EUnited is an association for companies in a range of engineering sectors in the mechanical, electrical and electronic industries.  
The association includes six sectors which are Cleaning, Metallurgy, Municipal Equipment, Robotics, Valves and Vehicle Cleaning.
